review_title: Positive team environment, opportunity for promotion
job_title: Quality Improvement Analyst in Ukiah, CA
pros: Positive coworkers, beautiful location, laid back environment, opportunity for advancement (they promote within the company a lot), sense of purpose and giving back to the community.  Everybody I talked to enjoyed working there.
cons: Health insurance plan not that great.  Slightly low pay due to tight budget in community health clinics, but its in a rural area so cost of living is lower too.  Raises aren't available very often, although you can earn a raise if you do a good job and stick around long enough.

pros: The company does do nice things like Christmas bonuses and gifts for employees
cons: VERY strict PTO policy. I had to use several hours worth of my pto for various doctors appointments as I’m battling an autoimmune disease that they were trying to diagnose. Because of this when I wanted to take an afternoon off to visit family out of town, my request was denied. I wasn’t allowed to simply take an hour or two unpaid, they would not let me go at all. So beware, if you have health issues that force you to use up pto, you will not be allowed to take any time off,

review_title: Lot of heart but mixed experience
pros:
Kind people who care
 A noble mission and work
cons:
Disconnect between how jobs are discussed in interviews and realities on the ground. The vision is to have a open, collaborative culture where all voices are valued and heard. Reality is that it is still very hierarchical and one must earn ones place before one can contribute. 
 Only allows 3 sick days per year but encourages you to stay home if feel unwell at all. Also doesn't have many official holidays so be aware that you'll be working while other family members might have time off. It will be on you to advocate for your recharge/rest/down time.
 It also seems to constantly understaffed.

pros: Great vision and mission; caring people.

review_title: They seem to apricate your work nut unsure.
job_title: Patient Service Representative in Ukiah, CA
pros: Lots of down time and you get lots of rewards when you do good.
cons: HR seems to care more about money then the patients.
